result.execSummary:
The defendant Romell I. Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and fees by 10-25-2019 or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Credit for 23 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Concurrent with: Count 2

Credit for 23 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Concurrent with: Count 1

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) and voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Romell I. Edwards

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Romell I. Edwards in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve TWENTY-THREE (23) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for TWENTY-THREE (23) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant sentenced to serve TWENTY-THREE (23) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for TWENTY-THREE (23) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and fees BY 10-25-2019 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9).  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
MILDRED E. to the Court.  Filed, sdg.
Defendant to the Court.  Filed, sdg.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.

Defendant Romell I. Edwards in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KENNETH E appeared on behalf of the Defendant.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  DEFENDANT TO COMPOSE LETTER PER INSTRUCTION OF THE COURT.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
received and filed.
Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 33 on October 13, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. Public defender's office will need to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Discharge Summary from JusticePoint received and filed.  LMS
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Non-Compliance report, received and filed. lms

Defendant Romell I. Edwards in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has tested positive and needs to pay assessment fee.   Defendant has completed community service and attended all appointments.  Review hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms

Defendant Romell I. Edwards in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Not doing so well.  Defendant needs to get back on track.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for 01-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Romell I. Edwards in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant continues to test negative and has attended all but one JusticePoint appointment.  Defendant needs to provided documentation of community service and pay assessment fee.  Review hearing scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Romell I. Edwards in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the report.  Defendant has attended all appointments and tested negative.  Defendant has completed 6 hours of community service at church.    Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Romell I. Edwards in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court approves the agreement.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 1 & 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2 as charged in the Information and STAYS a judgment of conviction.  Review hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court.  Kevin R Shomin for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Smith has contacted the defendant who is having transportation issues today.  Defendant has had a TAD evaluation and has a monitoring agency for the DPA.  Defense asks for a stayed bench warrant.  Court stays a warrant to the next date.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Romell I. Edwards in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received discovery.  Case may be resolved with a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant needs to have a TAD evaluation.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Romell I. Edwards in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Nathaniel Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no drug paraphernalia.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Romell I. Edwards in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Romell I. Edwards in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 1.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
